definitions: To give something to someone else, especially after you have used it or owned it for a period of time.
To transmit something, such as information or a disease, to another person or thing.
To decide not to take part in something or to refuse an offer.
examples: She decided to pass on the opportunity.
He passed on his old car to his son.
The tradition has been passed on for generations.
My grandmother passed on peacefully last night.
